column1: Besides the function-space view, what is another way to introduce GPs?
What does Bayesian linear regression specify as a prior distribution?
Given data X, y and weights w what is the likelihood?
What does a Bayesian approach do to the parameters?
How can the model be made nonlinear with Bayesian linear regression?
What is the "kernel trick" in relation to linear regression?
column2: Replacing inner products between vectors with k(x, x').

column1: What is the basis function mapping to in the "kernel trick" context?
When does the weight space view of a Gaussian process equivalent to the function space view?
column2: When using a zero-mean Gaussian prior.

column1: What is the connection between a GP and a linear model with basis functions?
column2: It's equivalent as long as the GP has mean zero and covariance k(x, x') = φ(x)Σρφ(x')
